subject: Productivity
title: The Stress Response
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Stress Response.

hook.text: Cortisol was designed to save your life for five minutes. Now it runs all day and wrecks your health.

buildup.text: The fight-or-flight response floods the body with cortisol and adrenaline. Energy surges instantly.

discovery.text: Short-term stress sharpens focus and speed. It's why deadlines sometimes boost performance.

twist.text: Chronic stress keeps cortisol elevated. This damages memory, disrupts sleep, and weakens immunity.

climax.text: The key is acute stress with recovery. Stress and rest in rhythm. Never stress without the pause.

punchline.text: Stress without recovery isn't performance. It's burnout.

quiz.question: What happens when cortisol stays elevated chronically?
options: It damages memory, sleep, and immunity
